item.title: Noise from loud speaker, 30th June
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kingsmead Way, Hackney, London

item.title: Obstructing private driveways and blocking entire pavements preventing safe use by pedestrians, 30th June
item.description:
These individuals are attending a mosque located on the corner of Chapel Lane and park with absolutely zero consideration. Blocking private driveways, both sides of the road on an already narrow road and mounting entire pavements with no consideration for the pedestrians and residents of the street, many of whom are elderly. These individuals also have carers who are unable to park closer to the homes that they are visiting. God forbid these individuals needed any medical assistance, there is no way an ambulance would be able to fit into the street. As residents we are incredibly considerate of each other and always put our vehicles on our driveways, especially where homes are facing each other and require space to safely exit and enter your properties. We have collectively reported this ongoing issue to a number of organisations with little to no progress. When approaching the individuals and asking them to make use of the parking lots available for public use we are met with aggression, rudeness and the reason being ‘it’s only for a few hours’. Within these few hours we all need to come and go from our homes but they outright insist on causing obstructions and safety issues for all drivers and pedestrians.

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish overflowing and all over floor, 30th June
item.description:
The rubbish hasn't been collected and is overflowing all over the floor. Foxes have ripped open the bins and there's now food with maggots on the floor and across the footpath to get to the bins. The bin itself has a broken wheel which needs to be repaired

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Springdale Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
